intro: Byttneria brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed byttneria, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, quadrangular stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, and it produces woody capsules that contain small, round seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
